data.title: Maria Schell
data.meta_description: IN THE 1950s Maria Schell was one of Europe’s most celebrated film actresses, often playing soulful or deeply troubled individuals. She worked with Luchino Visconti and René Clément and won best
data.text:
IN THE 1950s Maria Schell was one of Europe’s most celebrated film actresses, often playing soulful or deeply troubled individuals. She worked with Luchino Visconti and René Clément and won best actress awards at both Cannes and Venice. For a brief period she was in huge demand with the Hollywood studios and was cast opposite Yul Brynner in The Brothers Karamazov (1958), in a role Marilyn Monroe had desperately wanted. After turning her back on the movie business in the 1960s, she reappeared in high-profile supporting roles in the following decade and played one of the members of the Krypton ruling council in Superman (1978).

Maria Margarethe Anna Schell was born into an artistic family in Vienna in 1926. Her father, Hermann Ferdinand Schell, was
